intro: Cleistes libonii, commonly known as the sacred lotus of the Andes, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Oenotheraceae family and is characterized by its unique, cup-shaped flowers that resemble small bells. The plant produces showy, fragrant blooms that are typically white or pale pink, with intricate patterns on the petals. Cleistes libonii thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forests or rocky habitats. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
